episodes.title: Jehovah's Witness
episodes.description:
In recent years, the leaders of the Jehovah's Witnesses have come under fire for policies and practices that critics say have allowed child sex abuse to become a widespread problem across the United States and around the world. 

The organization has spent millions to settle lawsuits filed by abuse victims in a number of states, including Pennsylvania. 

Shawn Bartlett, records management overseer for the Watchtower, spends nearly an hour explaining the Witnesses' new record management policies.
